record.title: PARLIAMENTARY INQUIRIES
record.chair: The gentleman may state his inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. Speaker, isn't it true that the result of waiving a rule of the House for a specific bill means that rule does not apply for that bill?

record.chair: Would the gentleman repeat his parliamentary inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. Speaker, isn't it true that waiving a particular rule of the House for a specific bill means that rule does not apply for that bill?

record.chair: A rule may be waived in favor of a particular bill.
The gentleman may state his parliamentary inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: Isn't it true, Mr. Speaker, that H. Res. 317, the rule for H.R. 1905, the bill we just considered, waived clause 10 of rule XXI?

record.chair: With regard to H.R. 1905, H. Res. 317 did waive clause 10 of rule XXI.
The gentleman may state his parliamentary inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: Isn't it further true, Mr. Speaker, that clause 10 of rule XXI requires the PAYGO provision to be in effect?

record.chair: Clause 10 of rule XXI is informally referred to as pay-as-you-go.
The gentleman may state his parliamentary inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: Isn't it true then, Mr. Speaker, that the PAYGO rule adopted by this House was waived for the bill that we just considered, H.R. 1905?

record.chair: Clause 10 of rule XXI was waived with regard to that bill.
The gentleman may state his parliamentary inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: So the rule of this House that relates to PAYGO was waived for H.R. 1905.

record.chair: Clause 10 of rule XXI was waived with regard to H.R. 1905.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. Speaker, I have a parliamentary inquiry.

record.chair: The gentleman will state his parliamentary inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. Speaker, am I not correct that by adoption of the rule, we ensured that 1905 will not pass through the door to the Senate without PAYGO being attached to it?

record.chair: The Chair will read section 3(a) of the rule. "If either H.R. 1905 or H.R. 1906 fails of passage or fails to reach the question of passage by an order of recommital, then both such bills, together with H.R. 1433, shall be laid on the table."
The gentleman from Maryland may state his parliamentary inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: Am I correct that the interpretation of that language means that if the D.C. enfranchisement bill does not have PAYGO added to it, it will not pass this House?

record.chair: If either bill fails of passage, then both bills are laid on the table.

speaking.paragraph: I thank the Speaker for the clarification.
